alert.note: Alert for Delaware Beaches (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 26 at 4:04PM EDT until September 27 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents will occur. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of up to 8 feet are expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Warning, one to two feet of inundation above ground level is expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...The coast of Sussex County Delaware. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Wednesday evening. For the High Surf Advisory, until 8:00 PM Wednesday. For the Coastal Flood Warning, until midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At this level, widespread roadway flooding occurs in coastal and bayside communities and along inland tidal waterways. Many roads become impassable. Some damage to vulnerable structures may begin to occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion are expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore and into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels will remain elevated through the balance of the week, with minor or near minor tidal flooding possible with the high tides on Wednesday evening and Thursday evening. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Delaware Bay at Lewes MLLW Categories - Minor 6.0 ft, Moderate 7.0 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 26/07 PM 7.4 2.8 2.2 Moderate 27/07 AM 6.1 1.5 1.6 Minor 27/08 PM 6.5 1.8 1.2 Minor 28/08 AM 5.8 1.2 0.9 None 28/09 PM 6.3 1.7 1.0 Minor 29/09 AM 6.2 1.5 1.0 Minor &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Conditions in the surf are extremely dangerous. Stay out of the water.
